result.execSummary:
The defendant Hunter M. Bjork was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:31 This includes 14CF20  Defendant Hunter M. Bjork in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Defendant Hunter M. Bjork in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Thorie - recomendation is 6 months jail.  133 days credit per Thorie.  Atty  Nelson states 138 days credit. Court orders time served on each case concurrent. Appeal rights are given to the defendant.

4:15  This includes 13CM260 14CF6, 14CF19, 04CF20  Defendant Hunter M. Bjork in court with attorney Daniel J. Chapman.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Thorie -  Amended information is filed on 13CF81. Misd Theft - def will plead guilty to this amended charge.  14CF20  Ct 2  Plead to chg violation of restraining order.  14CF6  Poss THC  plead guilty to that ct.  Remaining Cts will be dismissed.   Probation 2 years.  If successfully completes sentences defendant may apply for expungment.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def. Def pleads guilty to amended charge in 13CF81  Misd Theft. 14CF20  Defendant pleads guilty, 14CF6 Poss of THC defendant pleads guilty. Court finds the defendant guilty of the charges with guilty pleas on them . Remaining Cts in these cases are dismissed. 14CF19 is dismissed and 13CM260 is dismissed. Thorie will file amended information on cases that the court has dismissed one or more counts and the defendant plead guilty to one ct so expungment can be done. Court orders  S/W Probation 2 years on each  count conc to each other in all the cases where defendant plead guilty  14CF6, 14CF20, 13CF81. Cond: Court costs  on 13CF81, 14CF6, 14CF20.    On 14CF20 and 14CF6  DNA surcharge of $200.00 on each case in addition to court costs. . Appeal rights on each case.
filed by Wm Thorie

2:05 Defendant Hunter M. Bjork in court with attorney Daniel J. Chapman.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  14CF6 and 14CF20 set for preliminary hearing today. 13CF81 and 13CM260  following along. Court reads charges and maximum penalties on 14CF6, 14CF19 and 14CF20. Court goes over Preliminary Hearing and Questionnaire and Waiver form with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def waives his right to have a preliminary hearing on each of the 3 files. Court accepts and approves waiver. Court finds the Def probably commited those felonies and bind Def over for trial on all 3 felony files. Thorie files information on 14CF6,19,20. Def has a copy of the information. Court reads the charges and maximum penalties; Def waives further reading.
Plea hearing on August 18, 2014 at 04:00 pm.
